The iPhone Pros have a new look, there’s a new tier called “Air” and the vanilla model got such a major upgrade that many might skip the small Pro and get it instead.…

title: Deals: Poco F7 Ultra price drops, Xperia 10 VII on pre-order, plus Apple's new smart wearables
summary: This week the new iPhones may have stolen the spotlight, but they are still on pre-order and it’s not like Apple offers any pre-order freebies, so let’s focus on other phones. We will pay a visit to Apple’s new smart wearables, though. Just last week, the Poco F7 Ultra was €580 for a 12/256GB unit …

title: Infinix GT 30 hands-on: a gamer-centric smartphone with customizable GT Shoulder Triggers
summary: Infinix launched the GT 30 Pro in May, and followed it up with the GT 30 in August, which was introduced in India first and made its global debut a few days ago. We spent some time with the Infinix GT 30 (aka Infinix GT 30 5G+), and here are our first impressions of the gamer-centric smartphone. [#…

title: Long throws are back - and Brentford are the masters
summary: Brentford are the masters of the long throw and it showed again with their late equaliser against Chelsea on Saturday.

title: Compromised Google Calendar invites can hijack ChatGPT’s Gmail connector and leak emails
summary: A security researcher has demonstrated how a malicious Google Calendar invite can prompt-inject ChatGPT and coax it into leaking private emails once Google connectors are enabled.

title: Nintendo revives Virtual Boy after 30 years for the Switch and Switch 2 — lets you play 3D Nintendo Classics titles to bring back the nostalgia
summary: Nintendo is reviving the Virtual Boy 3D console with an accessory that accepts your Switch or Switch 2 handheld.

title: Spacious 24TB hard drive is available for a mere 1 cent per GB — Seagate's BarraCuda 24TB is back on sale for $249
summary: This Seagate BarraCuda 24TB HDD is available at Newegg for $249—one of its best prices to date and an excellent deal for anyone in need of storage.

title: China’s Great Firewall suffers its biggest leak ever as 500GB of source code and docs spill online — censorship tool has been sold to three different countries
summary: Chinese censorship suffered a significant breach on September 11, when researchers confirmed that more than 500GB of internal documents had been dumped online.

title: AI-driven search engine running inside a laundry room aims to rival Google, and you can try it yourself — programmer harnesses old server parts and AI to deliver quality results
summary: Searcha Page and Seek Ninja are a one-person operation that utilizes AI to deliver relevant search results without relying on Google.

title: DNA ‘cassette tape’ research hints at petabyte-scale cartridges and multi-century lifespan on paper — petabytes-per-meter density possible, but today it writes at kilobytes per hour
summary: Chinese researchers have developed a DNA cassette tape drive that theoretically offers petabytes of storage, but it fails in real-world tests.

title: Asus ZenScreen MB27ACF monitor review: A slick portable screen with solid gaming performance
summary: Asus delivers solid performance and flexibility in its transportable ZenScreen MB27ADF. It sports an IPS panel with QHD resolution, 100 Hz, a folding stand and a desk mountable arm. It’s light and thin with quality sound and solid gaming performance.

title: Corsair lost a lawsuit over advertising XMP memory speeds, and you could get paid — the settlement covers U.S. purchases between 2018 and 2025 for overclocked kits
summary: The gap between memory speed marketing and JEDEC reality landed Corsair in a class-action lawsuit back in 2022—one that is currently accepting applications for payouts from the settlement.

title: Compact copper-encased 14.2-liter PC system weighs 47.4 pounds, doesn't need fans for cooling — passive ITX case is nearly twice as heavy as the aluminum shrouded version
summary: The Compact FanlessVC2300S DT ITX case will be sold in a limited-edition, completely copper version.

title: Redditor fishes a fully-functional Core i5-9400F and GTX 1660 PC gaming rig out of the trash
summary: A Redditor enjoyed a big ‘W’ after fishing out a PC packing an Intel Core i5-9400F, Nvidia GeForce GTX 1660, and more

title: Aiming for the top - Kang's dramatic impact on WSL
summary: London City Lionesses owner Michele Kang talks exclusively to BBC Sport about multi-club ownership, transfer fees, building a fanbase and her vision to take the club to the top of the game.

title: Nvidia may have ended RTX 50 Founders Edition GPU production — report suggests move is in preparation for 'Super' refresh
summary: Nvidia RTX 50 Founders Edition cards may be sidelined until a Super refresh arrives.

title: Export restrictions force Galax to build cutdown RTX 5090D V2 HoF — gaming performance is, fortunately, nearly identical to original 5090D HoF
summary: A Chinese content creator has benchmarked Galax' latest RTX 5090D V2 Hall of Fame XOC graphics card. The new model provides virtually identical performance to the RTX 5090D despite having less memory bandwidth and memory capacity.

title: Nvidia steps back from DGX Cloud — stops trying to compete with AWS and Azure
summary: Nvidia’s DGX Cloud, once positioned as a direct-to-enterprise AI cloud, has quietly taken a backseat in the company’s external strategy.

title: OpenAI and Microsoft reach an understanding over ongoing contract negotiations — but AGI clause remains an uncertainty
summary: OpenAI and Microsoft has struck a memorandum of understanding on their ongoing contract negotiations, opening the door for OpenAI to begin corporate restructuring.

title: New DDR5 module features an OLED display you probably won't see after installation — shows off RAM's specs and vitals
summary: V-Color unveils new XFinity+ DDR5 memory modules with built-in OLED display.

title: Legendary combat sim enthusiast builds frankly dangerous fighter jet rig — features three-axis motion seat, a cannon, afterburners, and a chaff launcher
summary: A combat sim creator built an air combat sim gaming rig that moves with you and shoots guns, missiles, and chaff.

title: SK hynix completes development of next-gen HBM4 — 2,048-bit interface and 10 GT/s speeds promised for next-gen AI accelerators
summary: SK hynix has finalized development of its HBM4 memory stacks with a 2,048-bit interface and 10 GT/s speed, 25% above JEDEC specs.

title: Borderlands 4 on PC crushing even the most powerful rigs — RTX 5090 struggles in some scenarios, but day one patch solves plenty of issues
summary: Borderlands 4 has arrived on PC to a chorus of criticism over performance and stuttering. Early reports from players described low frame rates and frequent crashes, even on high-end hardware.

title: Seagate's humongous 28TB HDD is a massive deal for a limited time at just $11.75 per TB — Desktop Expansion HDD on sale at Best Buy for $329
summary: A massive 28TB backup solution for your desktop setup. Seagate's Expansion HDD is $329 in a limited-time Best Buy sale.

title: Amazon says bug caused select Echo Show devices to use tons of data — widgets caching large images caused gigabytes of internet usage
summary: Amazon says that a bug in a widget on select Echo Show devices caused them to cache high-resolution images and use up a ton of data.

title: Nintendo Switch 2 mod adds over an hour of playtime with bigger 8,000mAh battery — unofficial replacement battery packs sell for as little as $40

title: Netgear Orbi 370 Wi-Fi 7 mesh router review: Dual-band Wi-Fi 7 hardware finally makes Orbi affordable
summary: With a much lower price point compared to its Orbi siblings, the Orbi 370 looks to tackle the entry-level Wi-Fi 7 market.

title: Intel Xeon chief architect leaves just 8 months after appointment — Ronak Singhal latest departure in ongoing shakeup
summary: Ronak Singhal, Intel Xeon chief architect, departs from the company just eight months after his appointment and after 28 years at the company.

title: Nvidia and Kioxia target 100 million IOPS SSD in 2027 —  AI server drives aim to deliver 33 times more performance
summary: Kioxia is working with Nvidia to develop a 100 million IOPS SSD for AI servers by 2027, likely leveraging unconventional NAND architectures.
